summary: This document is a report on the status of implementation of actions designed to counter Cuban subversion in Latin America during September 1963. It details efforts by various U.S. agencies, including the Department of State, Central Intelligence Agency, Department of Defense, and United States Information Agency, to control travel to and from Cuba, movement of propaganda, clandestine movement of guerrillas and arms, transfer of funds, strengthen counter-insurgency capabilities and exchange intelligence on Cuban subversion. Also includes surveillance of Cuban diplomatic, commercial and cultural and other special actions.
tags: Restrictions on Travel to and From Cuba
title: ICCCA: REPORT ON STATUS OF IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIONS DESIGNED TO COUNTER SUBVERSION
